locutie.beschrijving: The sermon parallels the 1994 inauguration of Nelson Mandela with the Ascension of Christ, interpreting political 'transfiguration' as a sign of Christ's reign.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Moderate. Uses Hebrews 1:3 and Psalm 47 as a lens for current events rather than deep textual drilling.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting a theological interpretation of history (analogy) and encouraging a specific perspective.
voorbeelden: The meaning of Ascension Day is that Jesus the Son of God reigns over all things.
God has planned it that way.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To inspire hope, provide a sense of global divine order, and encourage local resistance to evil.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Explicitly mentioned as the power behind the 'human story' and 'discernment'.

voorbeelden: Jesus is not only Lord of the rulers...
The Ascension is not accessible to scientific investigation.
Clap your hands, all you peoples
May God grant that we too will resist
It is hard to resist the happy thought...
I have tried to reassure her...

commissieven.kwaliteit: Weak. Promises are mostly reported as past reassurances to others rather than direct address to the current congregation.

declaratieven.autoriteit: Low. The preacher acts as a reporter/commentator rather than a mandatory of the Word.

indicatoren: Extensive quoting of news reports (Clines, Time, Washington Post)
Describing the feelings of Tutu and Mandela
Explaining what the Ascension 'means' as a concept
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a spectator of God's work in South Africa rather than a participant in God's grace today.

missende_elementen: Direct Promise of Grace to the 'you'
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Inspiration without encounter; information without transformation.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Indirect. The promise is 'brought home' but largely through analogy and reported speech.
voorbeelden: he is Lord in her life and will not let her go.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Preacher as narrator ('I spoke recently', 'I leave you').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Mostly in the final third, shifting to 'you' and 'we'.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominant. Discussing Mandela, Tutu, the devil, and 'the people'.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Historical reporting of the South African inauguration.

actueel_present.gebruik: Final application to the local heart.

voorbeelden: The Ascension is... [Assertive] -> May God grant that we too will resist [Directive]
foutief_patroon.probleem: The 'Promise' (Commissive) is missing as the bridge, making the call to action feel like a moralistic addition to a news report.

voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: The world will not forget... [Indicative] -> May God grant that we too will resist [Imperative]

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a theological commentary on current events. It 'talks about' the Ascension by using South Africa as an illustration, but rarely 'performs' the Ascension for the hearer.

sterke_punten.effect: Creates a vivid mental image of joy.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Lengthy quotes from the New York Times and Time Magazine.
zwakke_punten.probleem: The pulpit becomes a news desk.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is an 'event' of storytelling, but not a 'sacramental event' where the Word creates what it says.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: Lacks the 'Toezegging' (Promise) that binds God to the hearer here and now.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is the subject of the sentences, but rarely the speaker of the sermon.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Preacher acts more as an observer/analyst than a mandatory.
tekstueel_bewijs: It seems to me that, again, there is an analogy...

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, as the one working in the 'human story'.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly left to the 'eyes of faith'.
tekstueel_bewijs: The Holy Spirit... will be at work... in the human story.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Weak. The sermon is a 'message' about a 'miracle' elsewhere.
tekstueel_bewijs: And here is the latest report from South Africa...

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many 'is/was' verbs; needs more 'I promise/I declare/He gives' verbs.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The meaning of Ascension Day is that Jesus the Son of God reigns over all things.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, the ascended Christ takes his seat over your life and declares his victory over your fears.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a definition (Constative) to an encounter (Performative).

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is hidden in an anecdote about another woman.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Address the congregation directly with the promise of Christ's presence.
voorbeeldzinnen: Because Christ is ascended, I promise you: he will never let you go.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much 'they' (South Africans) and not enough 'you'.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Reduce the news quotes by 50% and increase direct address.
voorbeeldzinnen: You are the God-squad in New York tonight.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The 'resist' command is not clearly fueled by the 'forgiveness' of the Ascension.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Ground the call to respect neighbors in the declarative fact that Christ has already cleansed the land.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A rhetorically brilliant comparison that risks turning the pulpit into a lecture podium. To move from 'talking about' to 'happening', the preacher must speak as Christ's ambassador, not just his reporter.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' of joy; SAT focuses on whether the words 'The kingdom has become...' actually effect a change in the hearer's status.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric admires the Mandela analogy; SAT asks if the analogy carries illocutionary force.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon is 'felicitous' only if the hearer leaves not just informed about South Africa, but 'bound' by the promise of Christ.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The meaning of Ascension Day is that Jesus the Son of God reigns over all things.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Low - defines a concept rather than enacting a reign.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: I have tried to reassure her that... he is Lord in her life and will not let her go.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'miracle' of 1994 to provide the 'event' character, which risks making the sermon dependent on external history rather than the internal power of the proclaimed Word.
